attributes.comment:
I respectfully request that the proposed fee increases for visa
applications/petitions NOT be approved, as set forth in the Proposed Rules, dated
February 1, 2007 (Federal Register, Vol. 72, No. 21). The rate increases are
exhorbitant; it would be more equitable to gradually increase the rates on an as-
needed basis. It is clear that the negative impact of these rate increases will
affect exclusively those immigrants who can least afford them. The proposed
steep rate increases seem philosophically contrary to our nation's "open door
policy" that has traditionally welcomed immigrants and the contributions they have
made and continue to make to our country. I advocate that these fees not be
increased at this time to the levels proposed--in some cases to an exhorbitant
level almost three times the current fee (as in the case of the I-129E and the I-
485).

In the case of the I-485, the Proposed Rules document states that "interim
benefits are added to this form type". These benefits refer to obtaining a work
permit until such time the I-485 visa is issued. Currently this is a two-step
process, which is optional. The proposed change presumes that ALL I-485
applicants will want this benefit--which may or may not be the case.

Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Elizabeth Kramer
